author: Howard Batt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: I loaded it, connected it to the hose and sprayed.  Nothing other than water came out.  I yelled at it, turned it on and off - no joy.  I wrote customer service on FB and got an immediate reply but it was too test it in a white bucket and call back if I still had the problem.  Very nice person but not the answerThis version has no "straw" so think about what that means.  It means the cup has to be entirely full so the liquid is in contact with the top.  If it's not it won't work.  It's that simple.  It must be full before it will dispense fertilizerNext is quite a bit of the product sits un-dissolved on the bottom of the cup.  The answer?  Fill the cup with product in it almost to the top with waterr.  Stir until the product is completely dissolved.  It doesn't take long.One other problem people have complained about - leaking.  If there's no washer at the hose connection, it's going to leak.  Check to see that the washer didn't fall out at some point.  If it did or if for any reason you don't see one in the connection, put one there  - they're cheap but indispensableI was frustrated and now I'm happy.
title: answers to a couple of problems

review_content: Skirt and shoe and sleeve are soaking wet as I write this, thanks to this crappy product. Shut it off, did not want to be soaked with MiracleGro.)Silly me, did not even glance at reviews because I used one like this 15 yrs ago, and I thought it was the same thing. This sprayer is a POS.Why are you still selling it, MiracleGro, after all these negative reviews?? It is not a water pressure issue or damage. It is an inherent design problem.
title: LEAKS LIKE A SIEVE! DO NOT BUY!!!!!

author: Charles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2019
review_content: Low expectations based on many other negative reviews, but for me with one use it was far better than I had hoped for.The good stuff included the trigger is variable, for example for my just potted seedlings, I was able to gently press the trigger so that they were watered with a slow stream but not harmed.  The three position head adds to that flexibility.  Only had a very small leak using full power on the jet position, not much leakage but some compared to none on the other setting there was some but minimal.My only slightly non positive thought was that I wasn’t sure when the fertilizer was being applied at less than full strength as the base chemical was running out.  My solution was to dump the remaining jar contents into a watering can and dilute the remainder with water.  Turned out looking like the mix i normally use with a watering can.I made sure to take off the plastic cover on the jar before starting and I used only half of the fertilizer provided, and also thoroughly rinsed the jar and sprayed clear water to cleanse the head when I was finished.So much better than making 20 trips with a watering can.So five stars for me.Charles
title: Had Very Low Expectations, but

author: loveamazon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2019
review_content: The idea of this product is nice. It is much more effective than hand mixing into a watering can and individually applying to each plant, especially if you have a large area to treat. Unfortunately, the mixing process does not seem completely worked out and the food mix does not seem to dilute well in the water. A small fill is supposed to treat a certain square footage, but after nearly doubling that area, I still had a large amount of mix left in the sprayer. It is still a step up from doing it by hand, but it really feels ineffective in terms of providing the right amount per plant or sq. /ft. based on the amount used during the process.
title: Sprays Great, Mixes Poorly

author: KT Palm Springs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021
review_content: **REVIEW UPDATE**  I am posting this update to share what I learned regarding the leaking reported by so many reviewers.  At first I did not experience any leaking as mentioned in my original review below, however, after a few uses the issue did start occurring.  At first I just kept trying to screw on the top more, but that was not the problem.  The sprayer has a yellow circle which allows you to select from 3 different spray patterns.  I noticed the source of the leak was that water was dribbling out from one of the 3 spray holes other than the main one that I had selected.  If you observe the face of the yellow circle and watch closely, you can rotate the spray pattern selector either to the left or right only a tiny amount, the dribbling will stop.  It's easy to see if you just watch it as you slowly turn the dial.  This solved the leaking issue for me so I hope this can possibly help others as well. ****  Original Review Follows:I didn't read reviews prior to purchasing this because I've had these in years past and never had any problems, plus,  I felt like the brand name of Miracle Gro was a name I could trust.  I began reading the reviews after the product arrived but before I actually used it.  Based on the large number of people who complained about excessive leaking, I figured I would probably have to return it.  So I was pleasantly surprised when I did use it, to find out that it did NOT leak.  I can't imagine all of these people are just making this up, unless the reviews were old and the design has been improved, however, it seemed to work fine for me.  My only comment is that when you turn on the water, it takes quite a while for the feeder tank to fill with water.  So based on the instructions, it would seem like you have to use it for several minutes before it will actually begin feeding  I'm thinking I could fill the tank with water first before I turn it on, to avoid this issue.
title: Not sure why all the negative reviews.

author: Straight_Talk

A total complete disappointment and waste of money.

author: Mountain Wind

review_content: As others have indicated with theirs, my sample of the sprayer did not spray fertilizer in the container's upright (proper) position.Shaking the container -- to promote fertilizer pickup,  as one reviewer suggested -- did not work. author: Bryan Molick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2021
review_content: I have always been a fan of Miracle-Gro fertilizer. Not so much with this feeder. The main issue I have is the fact that you don't know what amount if any fertilizer is coming out. I assume the way the suction of the fertilizer works is once the jar is 100% full of water it is forced to draw the contents of the jar into the flow of water. The flaw that I question is the first few minutes of spraying will be a higher amount of fertilizer because as you continue, more water is filling up the jar and diluting the mixture. In my case, I killed the first potted plant I fertilized and I'm really not sure how much the other plants received.I will continue to use Miracle-Gro but the old fashioned way. One scoop per gallon of water in a 5 gallon bucket.
title: How much fertilizer is coming out? Who knows.

author: RedRover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2019
review_content: Worked just fine. No leaks. Removed container, remover clear plastic seal. Tightened container on sprayer hand tight. Attached hose....again hand tight. Turned on faucet. Sprayed. Removed container and pour the residual on the base of a large shrub. It was easy and it worked like it should. Why not all 5 Stars.....well let’s see if it works on the plants.

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: I installed some Kurapia in a previously bare-earth area, and after nine months it seemed to be a bit slow filling in, so I bought this to apply plant food to the area to help it grow. There are three spray settings and they work well. It lays down a nice full spray but not too much too fast...

author: Alana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
review_content: Well it's simple enough to use. Add a measured amount of miracle grow or whatever into the bowl. Then screw the top (handle )assembly) onto the bowl. When I used it I had no problems and it worked the was I had expected.

author: Windowshopper2c
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: I have a couple of the old sprayers, boy they are so much better than these new ones.  The new ones don't measure out the food right. author: Gregory T Reid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2016
review_content: The first one that I received leaked very badly at the joint between the handle body and its hose attachment.  Not from the hose connection itself, which was leak-free, but from the body.  LOTS of leakage there, making a big mess and soaking my clothing.  I exchanged it for a replacement (thanks Amazon) -- but the replacement had exactly the same issue!  (Yes, I removed the plastic film from the cannister before use.)  And my hose pressure out at the garden where I was using it is actually quite low ... no way that I burst a seam due to "too high" water pressure.So I returned it again -- this time for a refund -- and ordered (from Amazon) a completely different style of mixer/sprayer: Chapin G362 Professional All Purpose Hose End Sprayer with Metering Dial.  It doesn't support the dry crystals from Miracle-Gro, so I also ordered some liquid fertilizer concentrate.  And I'll hopefully be able to use the crystals that remained in the returned Miracle-Gro sprayer by dissolving them in water for the Chapin sprayer.Anyway, based on my "two strikes" experience, and a few other reviewers who have noted the same heavy leaking issue, I'd advise steering clear of this poor quality (or poor quality control) sprayer.

author: Lani Honma

author: nsyv
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: So I've read a lot of reviews which state that these leak and mine did too right out of the box. author: sleeper

author: Scriptor

author: Amanda and Terri Lynn

author: AKO California
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2013
review_content: Works just fine for me, and I'm going by what the plants look like not what the water looks like coming out of this.  I've used an older model for years and until I read reviews here, I had never expected blue tinted water out of this thing.  The only time I used to get very noticeable blue water with the old one is when I inverted it to clean it out once it was down to only dilute solution.  The very slight tint of the water normally is only noticeable in the right light.It probably does not put out the most even solution concentration, but for outside it works just fine.  There's a small stream of water that shoots into the mixing container that slowly dissolves the powder.  That pushes the solution into the water stream which shoots it out the nozzle.  This does not create the same concentration as if you hand mixed a bucket, but outside you have to put down more water than inside due to the higher evaporation and the water soaking into the surrounding soil which isn't such an issue in a potted plant.  The question is, are the plants getting enough fertilizer?  From my experience, they are.  I've never looked at the lawn or plants and thought, that spot didn't get enough fertilizer.  There's much more variation from the sprinkler heads putting out different water coverage and the amount of sun or shade than fertilizer would explain.If coverage is a big concern, just do a different pattern each time and go over areas more than once.  At what I would think is normal speed, I actually cover the area that the full container is rated for at least 2 or 3 times.  In fact, I used to only use about 1/4 of the powder to cover that area and go over it about twice, until I read the instructions on this one.I've also used miracle gro for vegetables, but I don't use a sprayer, I soak the ground and just pour the powder where the hose goes into the water channels, so can't comment on that use.The one thing I don't like about this new model is it is now made in 2 pieces to add the spray control and water control.  The old one was one piece and only had an on/off valve.  The 2 pieces make it feel a flimsier and I expect it might break, where the old one I have actually still works.  I only needed to replace it since the container's plastic got so old it cracked.
title: Works just fine, seems less sturdy than old model

author: AzGal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2015
review_content: After years of watering by hand by mixing Miracle Grow fertilizer in a watering can I'm now completely sold on the Miracle Gro Garden Feeder. I wish I would have tried the feeder years ago! I was reluctant to try it because of the ratings, but this is SO much better than the watering can method. I have a fairly large garden so using the watering can used to take me at least an hour where I now feed the garden in about 10 minutes. Wow, so much more convenient! I now have two, one for tomato feeding and another for feeding the rest of the garden. There are a few issues with the feeder as reported by others, but these are easily overcome. First, it does leak where it screws onto the hose IF there is not enough water pressure. When the pressure is increased the leaking stops. Second, it does leak from the top when stored full, but this can be resolved by pouring out the top layer of water before storing the feeder. These simple solutions to the design flaws more than make up for never having to feed by hand again. Love this product.
